abstract: This week, Palm released a follow up to the Pre, a cheaper, thinner, lesser phone called the Pixi. The official price is $100 with a two-year Sprint contract, but Amazon is selling the thing for — are you sitting down? — $25.
snippet: This week, Palm released a follow up to the Pre, a cheaper, thinner, lesser phone called the Pixi. The official price is $100 with a two-year Sprint contract, but Amazon is selling the thing for — are you sitting down? — $25.
lead_paragraph: In June, the once-downtrodden mess of a company called Palm shocked the world by thrusting its arm from the grave, holding a gleaming, compact capsule called the Palm Pre. The Pre, of course, is an app phone like the iPhone, in fact designed by many of the same ex-Apple engineers, but with a slide-out keyboard, removable battery, and joyous touch screen software all its own.

headline.main: A $25 App Phone? That’s Crazy Talk.
headline.kicker: From the Desk of David Pogue
